solution_line_template: If Justin has {justin_dogs} dogs, Rico, who has {rico_more_dogs} more dogs than Justin, has {justin_dogs}+{rico_more_dogs}=<<{justin_dogs}+{rico_more_dogs}={rico_dogs}>>{rico_dogs} dogs.
Since Camden just bought {camden_fraction} times as many dogs as Rico, he bought {camden_fraction}*{rico_dogs}=<<{camden_fraction}*{rico_dogs}={camden_dogs}>>{camden_dogs} dogs.
A dog has {legs_per_dog} legs, so Camden's {camden_dogs} dogs have {camden_dogs}*{legs_per_dog}=<<{camden_dogs}*{legs_per_dog}={total_camden_dog_legs}>>{total_camden_dog_legs} legs.
